inputs.name: ddMonitorId
inputs.label: Monitor ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: A single monitor to which the downtime applies. If not provided, the downtime applies to all monitors.

inputs.name: ddMonitorTags
inputs.label: Monitor Tags
inputs.helpMarkDown: A comma-separated list of monitor tags. For example, tags that are applied directly to monitors, not tags that are used in monitor queries (which are filtered by the scope parameter), to which the downtime applies. The resulting downtime applies to monitors that match ALL provided monitor tags. For example, service:postgres AND team:frontend.

inputs.name: ddGroupScope
inputs.label: Group scope
inputs.helpMarkDown: The scope(s) to which the downtime applies. For example, host:app2. Provide multiple scopes as a comma-separated list like env:dev,env:prod. The resulting downtime applies to sources that matches ALL provided scopes (env:dev AND env:prod).

options.reportstartend: Report start and end of inactivity

inputs.name: ddStart
inputs.label: Start
inputs.helpMarkDown: POSIX timestamp to start the downtime. If not provided, the downtime starts the moment it is created.

inputs.name: ddEnd
inputs.label: End
inputs.helpMarkDown: POSIX timestamp to end the downtime. If not provided, the downtime is in effect indefinitely until you cancel it.

inputs.name: ddMinutes
inputs.label: Minutes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter how many minutes you want to silence (starting from the current time).

inputs.name: ddTimeZone
inputs.label: TimeZone
inputs.helpMarkDown: The timezone in which to display the downtime's start and end times in Datadog applications.

inputs.name: ddMessage
inputs.label: Message
inputs.helpMarkDown: A message to include with notifications for this downtime. Email notifications can be sent to specific users by using the same @username notation as events.
